intro: Aeollanthus glabrifolius, commonly known as the smooth-leaved aeollanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped, smooth leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
